author: Karina Martinez-Carter
title: You can nap in a sleep pod at these 16 airports
text:
You can nap in a sleep pod at these 16 airports USA Today 4 days ago Karina Martinez-Carter
© Provided by USA Today It requires some serious sleep deprivation and a certain level of desperation for me to try dozing off out in the open at an airport. More often than not, I’m too uncomfortable and I fear someone will run off with my belongings. But fortunately for those like me, more and more airports are installing sleeping options that allow passengers in transit to squeeze in some quick, quality sleep.
All these tiny rooms — whether they’re called pods, cubicles, cabs or capsules — provide a spot to snooze with some dignity, meaning not splayed out across three chairs for the gawking pleasure of passers-by . They’re mostly past airport security and all bookable by the hour, which is doubly convenient, plus budget friendly.
The options range in size, price and amenities provided — some even have high-def TVs — though the majority presently operating in airports are from a handful of chain providers like Yotel, which is a well-known capsule hotel brand. Some are self-service, and others, like Minute Suites (where they’ll even do you the courtesy of a wake-up call) are staffed. The more spartan, the cheaper they tend to be, with prices ranging from around $15 per hour to upwards of $30.
Here’s where to find airport nooks to take a nap:
Abu Dhabi (AUB): GoSleep pods in Terminal 3, at Gate 35.
Amsterdam Schiphol (AMS): Yotel capsule hotel, main terminal in Lounge 2, near Pier D. Note: The property is closed through the end of September due to terminal construction. GoSleep pods in Concourse D.
Atlanta (ATL): Minute Suites at Gate B16.
Berlin Tegel (TXL): Napcabs in the main hall, level 3.
Dallas-Fort Worth (DFW): Minute Suites at Gate D23.
Dubai (DXB): Snoozecube in Terminal 1, next to Gate C22. GoSleep pods in Emirates’ Maharba lounges.
Hanoi (HAN): Vietnam Aviation Tourism Corp ( VATC )-sponsored pods at the departures terminal.
© Photo courtesy of Yotel Helsinki (HEL): GoSleep pods at gates 31 and 37.
London Gatwick (LGW): Yotel capsule hotel, South terminal next to international arrivals.
London Heathrow (LHR): Yotel capsule hotel, Terminal 4, ground floor.
Munich (MUC): Napcabs in Terminal 2 (Level 4 at Gate G06 and Level 05 at Gate H32).
Narita (NRT): 9Hours capsule hotel in B1F on P2 in the multistory car park near Terminal 2.
New Delhi (DEL): SAMS (Snooze at my Space) pods opposite Gate 17 in international departures.
Orio al Serio Bergamo (BGY): ZzZleepandGo pods, newly opened.
Philadelphia (PHL): Minute Suites at Terminal A-B link.
Tallinn Airport (TLL): GoSleep pods at Gate 9 and in Nordea Lounge.
